data.title: Inside: - The Bowling News
data.text: Our 54th Year VOL. 54, NO. 47 www.TheBowlingNews.net NOVEMBER 25, 2010 Inside: Yes Fund Launches High School Bowling Grant Program launches. Page 9 PBA Senior tour schedule The Professional Bowlers Association has announced an expanded 11-tournament 2011 Senior Tour schedule. Page 12 PBA introduces new Xtra Frame Tour reality series As the PBA Tour begins its telecast season at 12 noon on Nov. 28 on ESPN, pba.com will again provide bowling fans with original programming through its new “Road to the Show” Xtra Frame reality series. Page 12 TCBA Standings Page 12 Features Pin Point to Ponder By Chuck Pezzano Page 4 Honor Roll Page 3 Tomorrow’s Stars Page 8 Sponsored by Classic Products Lane Laughter Page 9 Off the Sheet By Clint Dacy Page 16 PRESORTED STD U.S. POSTAGE PAID ARLINGTON, TX PERMIT NO. 419 AMF Showplace Euless manager Dickinson looking forward to a busy 2011 By Emil Williams Jr. Staff Writer It is not uncommon for a kid to follow in the footsteps of a family hero and in the case of Rusty Dickinson, he looked up to his uncle, Professional Bowlers Association and United States Bowling Congress Hall of Famer, Gary Dickinson. With a relative who was constantly on television, it would be only natural for Rusty to attempt a drive down that path. However, Rusty decided to go down a different path, but stayed very close to home. As a child, Rusty was always excited when he was able to spend time with Gary. He tagged Ross Hansen Ross Hansen, a member of NABI for 17 years took home his sixth win after an 11 year dryspell at AMF Spare Time Rusty Dickinson and Tina Taylor on the lanes. along at numerous bowling centers while Gary introduced him to several other professional bowlers. Unfortunately for Rusty, he didn’t have the opportunity to bowl as a child due to the lack of bowling centers in his hometown of Durant, OK, but he always kept an eye on his uncle. “I really loved watching my uncle bowl on Continued on Page 13 Hansen wins NABI at AMF Spare Time Lanes, Nov. 13-14. Hansen defeated Randy Franklin, 210-195, in the final match for the victory and collected $420. Franklin earned $210 as runner-up. In the Top 8 finals, Hansen eliminated Danny Monroe, 242- 174, and Ted Garner, 190-183, to get to the title match. Franklin’s road to the title match saw him besting Brenda Bassett, 215-162, and Jerry Willmon, 194-165. Garner and Willom finished Scroggins wins in Odessa for back-to-back Southwest Regional titles ODESSA — Mike Scroggins of Amarillo, dominated the field to win his 36th PBA Regional title at the sixth annual Professional Bowlers Association Southwest Region Odessa Open at Diamond Lanes Sunday. Scroggins earned $2,500 for the title. Scroggins bowled a 300 game the first game of the tournament and held off a few minor challenges in the match play portion of the event before pulling away and coasting to Continued on Page 16 Area 10 Special Olympics Bowling competition held. Page 19 third and fourth, respectively and earned $128 ($105 plus $23 from the Progressive Pot) each. Other Top 8 cashers were: 6-8. Vinny Meneades, Danny Monroe, Brenda Bassett, $80 each. Other cashers included: 9-16. Katie Meneades, Anthony Sewell, Sandy Willmon, Bob Kielich, Tyson Olivere, Ruben Davis, Patsy Taylor, James Ross, $70 each. High Qualifier (no-tap) Bob Kielich, $34, Brenda Continued on Page 10 Mike Scroggins Thomas wins second SASBA title Oklahoma’s Pete Thomas came from behind in the last match against leader Mark Williams to win his second Ebonite SASBA title Nov 13-14 at Del-Mar Lanes in Houston. Thomas had trouble early in the game, but came back with Pete Thomas strikes from the seventh frame, forcing Williams to double in the 10th to win. A split ended Williams chances and Thomas came out with the victory and the $1,000 first place prize. Williams earned $850 as runner-up and Rick Minier finished third for $730. Joe LeCroy won $620 for forthplace, while Jim Stephens rounded out the top five, collecting $510. The remaining finalists were: 6. Vetella Spicer, $450; 7. Donald Robinson, $400; 8. Shannon Starnes, $375; 9. Dave Lundgren, $350; 10. Robert Dunaway, $325; 11. Dennis Scott, $300; 12. Bill Ferguson, $280; 13. T.J. Johnson, $270; 14. Perry Dufrene, $260; 15. Albert Waites, $250; 16. Paul Houston, $240. Other cashers included: 17. Paul McCordic, $201; 18. Fred Barnes, $200; 19. Eric Roddy, $199; 20. John Denton, $198, 21. Dale Dumbleton, $197; 22. Roy Chesbro, $196; 23. Everett Davis, $195; 24. Merv Parrish, $194. High Super Senior (non-cash) David Rountree, Willie Wells, Butch Calvert, Rudy Garcia, Dee Munsell, Leo Plaia, $180 each. High Sunday Block (non-cash) Matt Stewart, $150. Friday Sweeper 1. Fred Barnes, 514’ 2. Bill Continued on Page 10
